intro: Sanicula bipinnatifida var. hoffmannii, commonly known as Hoffmann's bipinnate sanicle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features compound leaves with a bipinnate structure, giving it a finely divided, fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
